snippet: If they really want to contend for a title, maybe the Knicks should try a trade with the Los Angeles Lakers: Carmelo Anthony for Kobe Bryant.
abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column suggests that if New York Knicks really want to contend for a title, they should try for a trade with the Los Angeles Lakers, exchanging Carmelo Anthony for Kobe Bryant; holds that Phil Jackson needs to talk Bryant into somehow joining him in New York for one last great mission in both of their careers, setting the table for the Knicks to win another championship.
lead_paragraph: If they really want to contend for a title, maybe the Knicks should try a trade with the Los Angeles Lakers: Carmelo Anthony for Kobe Bryant.

headline.seo: Trading Carmelo Anthony for Kobe Bryant Would Benefit Knicks and Lakers
headline.main: Unlikely Superstar Swap Could Aid Knicks
headline.print_headline: Unlikely Superstar Swap Could Aid Knicks
